revised_title: Measurements of Specific Inductive Capacity of Dielectrics in Paraffin
tldr: This paper describes the instruments and processes used in a series of experiments on the specific inductive capacity of paraffin and the effect of temperature variations. The authors employed a platymeter and a sliding condenser to determine the capacity of a condenser. They found that the specific inductive capacity of paraffin remained constant at 1.977, with air taken as unity, regardless of temperature changes.
